Aktivis LSM: Jokowi Seharusnya Sejak Awal Tak Janjikan Perppu UU KPK
01 Nov 2019, 13:39 by Muhammad Irfan
JAKARTA, (PR).- Aktivis yang juga pendiri Lembaga Swadaya Masyarakat Lingkar Madani, Ray Rangkuti menilai, ketidakmauan Presiden Joko Widodo mengeluarkan Peraturan Pengganti Undang Undang terkait UU KPK karena alasan menggu proses di Mahkamah Konstitusi harusnya disampaikan sejak awal. Jangan sampai, langkah ini ibarat memberi harapan palsu kepada publik.
“Jika begitu adanya, rasanya dia (Jokowi) tidak memerlukan waktu yang lama untuk menjawab soal apakah akan mengeluarkan Perppu atau tidak,” kata Ray Rangkuti, Jumat 1 November 2019.
Sebagai Presiden, Jokowi tentu memiliki lebih dari cukup informasi soal adanya uji materi revisi UU KPK ke MK. Dengan informasi itu, sedianya Jokowi tidak perlu membuat janji menerbitkan Perppu atau tidak.
“Cukup Beliau sampaikan bahwa Perppu tidak dalam opsinya karena revisi UU KPK sejak satu hari dia ditetapkan telah digugat ke MK,” ucap dia.
Ray Rangkuti menilai, penggunaan alasan masih menunggu putusan MK untuk tidak menerbitkan Perppu juga janggal. Apalagi sampai menggunakan bumbu bahasa sopan dan santun pula. Padahal, kata Ray Rangkuti, tidak menepati janji juga jelas bukanlah tindakan yang sopan dan santun.
“Berterus terang sejak awal bahwa opsi Perppu tidak akan dikeluarkan jika ada masyarakat yang melakukan gugatan atas revisi UU itu adalah cermin dari sikap sopan dan santun itu. Seperti Presiden bersikap sopan atas kelembagaan negara, kewajibannya juga adalah bersikap sopan pada rakyatnya,” ucap dia.
Ray Rangkuti mengatakan, “Jika memang tidak siap mengeluarkan Perppu, mestinya diungkapkan sejak awal agar masyarakat tidak dalam posisi terombang ambing, menaikan asa, menanti harap lalu dikecewakan,” ucap dia.***

NGO Activist: Jokowi Shouldn't Have Promised Perppu on KPK Law from the Beginning
Nov 01 2019, 13:39 by Muhammad Irfan
JAKARTA, (PR). - Activist who is also the founder of the Non-Governmental Circle Society of Madurese, Ray Rangkuti considers President Joko Widodo's unwillingness to issue Regulations to replace the Law related to the KPK Law because of reasons for using the process in the Constitutional Court. Do not let this step is like giving false hope to the public.
"If that is the case, it seems he (Jokowi) does not need a long time to answer the question of whether to issue a Perppu or not," said Ray Rangkuti, Friday, November 1, 2019.
As President, Jokowi certainly has more than enough information about the existence of the material revision of the KPK Law to the MK. With that information, Jokowi should not have made an appointment to issue a Perppu or not.
"He simply said that the Perppu was not in its options because the revision of the KPK Law since one day he was determined to have been sued to the Court," he said.
Ray Rangkuti considered that the use of reasons was still awaiting the Constitutional Court's decision not to issue a Perppu. Moreover, to use a polite and polite language spice as well. In fact, said Ray Rangkuti, not keeping promises was also clearly not a polite and polite action.
"It was clear from the beginning that the Perppu option would not be issued if there were people who filed a lawsuit over the revision of the Act that was a reflection of that polite and polite attitude. Like the President being polite to state institutions, his obligation is also to be polite to his people, "he said.
Ray Rangkuti said, "If indeed it is not ready to issue a Perppu, it should be disclosed from the beginning so that the community is not in a position to be swayed, raising hopes, waiting and then disappointed," he said. ***
